title: Sean Combs
summary: Sean John Combs (born November 4, 1969),[5][6] known professionally as Puff Daddy (previously known as P. Diddy or Diddy), is an American rapper, record executive, record producer, and entrepreneur. Born in New York City and raised in the suburb of Mount Vernon, he worked as a talent director at Uptown Records before founding his own record label, Bad Boy Records in 1993. Combs has produced and cultivated artists such as The Notorious B.I.G., Mary J. Blige and Usher.
